place.name: HUISH CHAMPFLOWER
place.gazetteerText: HUISH-CHAMPFLOWER, a village and a parish in Dulverton district, Somerset. The village stands on the river Tone, 2¾ miles W by N of Wiveliscombe, and 9 NW of Wellington r. station; and has a post office under Wellington, Somerset. The parish comprises 2, 909 acres. Real property, £3, 370. Pop., 444. Houses, 77. The property is much subdivided. The manor belongs to Sir WalterTrevelyan, Bart. Iron mines are on the N border, on the Brendon Hills. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £445.* Patron, Sir W.Trevelyan, Bart. The church is ancient; and consists of nave, aisle, and chancel, with a tower. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
